ch.ecma.csta.media

Interface MediaListener

  • All Superinterfaces:
    java.util.EventListener
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    MediaAdapter

    public interface MediaListener
extends java.util.EventListener
    Not Supported.
    Initiates an event monitor on a specified device's media stream. Java listeners are used to implement the CSTA concept called monitoring.

    Add a listener to a device using the MediaServices.addMediaListener method. Adding a listener to a device is equivalent to requesting a Monitor Start service for that device.

    This interface provides a callback method declaration for each data collection event that can occur. In contrast, MediaAdapter extends this interface to provide a default implementation for each method declared in this interface.

    When an event occurs, the corresponding listener callback is called. The default callbacks provided by MediaAdapter do nothing. If you want to act upon events, you can customize the events' callbacks for your application in either of the following ways:

    • Provide an implementation of every callback method in this interface with a class that implements MediaListener.
    • Provide an implementation of a subset of callback methods with a class that extends MediaAdapter.

    Events that occurred prior to the MediaListener initiation are not reported.

    If multiple listeners are added to a device, then each listener will be notified of events on that device; the corresponding callback will be called on each listener that has been added.

    Event reports cease after the switching function terminates the monitor. Service termination can result from a client request (using the MediaServices.removeMediaListener method) or it can be initiated by the server. The switching function shall terminate the monitor if the monitored device ceases to exist, or if the monitored device leaves the switching sub-domain, such as through reconfiguration. There may be other conditions that cause the server to terminate the monitor.

    Version:
    $Revision: 1.4 $
    Author:
    AVAYA, Inc.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void mediaAttached(MediaAttachedEvent event)
      Not Supported.
      void mediaDetached(MediaDetachedEvent event)
      Not supported.

    • Method Detail

      • mediaAttached

        void mediaAttached(MediaAttachedEvent event)
        Not Supported.
        A callback function which is automatically invoked when the MediaAttachedEvent occurs on that device and this listener has been added to a device.

        Indicates an attachment of media services to a connection. This event may be generated as a result of a previous Attach Media Service service request, or as a result of an automatic media service attachment. See the MediaAttachedEvent for more information.

        Parameters:
        event - provides information received over a connection. collection, to the computing function.

      • mediaDetached

        void mediaDetached(MediaDetachedEvent event)
        Not supported.
        A callback function which is automatically invoked when the MediaDetachedEvent occurs on that device and this listener has been added to a device.

        Indicates a detachment of media services from a onnection. This event may be generated as a result of a previous Detach Media Service request, or as a result of an automatic media service detachment. See the MediaDetachedEvent for more information.

        Parameters:
        event - provides information received over a connection.
